title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 23 march [1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 March [1870]
text: ? | May 1870marchMarch 23 My dear waltWalti have just got your letter with the money in it i received the within letter last mondayMonday was glad to hear from mattyMatty i was very much worried for fear the storm had overtaken her and she had been detained but it seems she got home all safe i will write a few lines and send that part of the letter about the masons they could have just as well have accommadatedaccommodated her as not for a few days but i gessguess itsit's all for the best she didentdidn't go) i wasentwasn't favorable to her going at all but she had such a wish to go i didentdidn't say so much against it) George came home last saturdaySaturday very unexpetedunexpected he came to see about getting the inspecting of some pipe for the gas company but they didentdidn't make an agreementagreement so he went back on mondayMonday he is well looks most too fat and pussy but seems to be well) you must write the particulars about the new clothsclothes waltWalt) i have had mrsMrs. Brown and willie sWillie's wife here this afternoon) i aintain't quite so lame to day O waltWalt can you send the week for i have got up to the 17thi am reading the story good bie Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 23 March [1870]
